biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood samples will be processed for serum and then evaluated for BK virus DNA

brief_summary.textblock:
The objectives of this study is to establish the natural history of BK virus viremia and
      other possible opportunistic viral pathogens in renal transplants receipients.

clinical_study.brief_title: BK Virus Infection (Viremia) Natural History in Renal Transplant Recipients

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Natural History study in renal or renal-pancreas transplant recipients.  In an
      effort to capture patients early in the course of an evolving BK  virus infection and avoid
      patients who have already developed evidence of BKV-induced nephropathy (BKVN), this
      protocol will emphasize the initiation of screening in the early post-transplant period.
      Patients who have undergone renal or renal/pancreas transplantation within 4 weeks, but not
      more than 90 day previously, will be asked to participate  and then consented to be enrolled
      in a Natural History-Surveillance period for up to approximately 24 months. Participants
      enrolled in this study will provide valuable natural history data regarding BKV viremia, and
      potentially other viral pathogen, in the post-renal transplant period. Participants will
      provide blood samples to undergo measurement for plasma BKV DNA by PCR approximately every 6
      weeks, to be resulted in real time at the UAB Diagnostic Virology Laboratory at UAB.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Renal or renal-pancreas transplant patients who are within 4 weeks and not more than 90
        days post-transplant with or without qualifying BKV viremia Age greater than or equal to
        18 years; Provides written informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Evidence of proven or suspected BKVN by clinical or pathologic diagnostic criteria Loss of
        renal graft function Initiation of chronic dialysis

study_pop.textblock:
Male and female renal or renal-pancreas transplant  recipients  ages 18 and older at risk
        for BKV infection

facility.name: University of Colorado at Denver and HSC

clinical_study.official_title: Natural History of Infection Caused by BK Virus (and Other Opportunistic Viral Pathogens) in Renal Transplant Recipients

primary_outcome.description: We will measure the number of subjects screened who developes BK viremia within 4 weeks and up to 24 months after renal transplant
primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of BKV viremia in  the study population of screened renal or renal-pancreas transplant subjects
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 weeks  and up to 24 months after renal transplant

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the number of days until BK viremia is diagnosed
secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of BK viremia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks  and up to 24 months after renal transplant

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the length of time from onset to resolution of BK viremia after renal transplant
secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of BK viremia after diagnosis in renal transplant population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 week up to 24 months after renal transplant

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the occurance of increased serum creatinine and record data from pathologic examination of renal allograft
secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of BKVN in study population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks up to 24 months after renal transplant in study population

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the number of BK viral DNA found in plasma laboratory specimens over time after diagnosis of BK viremia in renal transplant study population.
secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitative measurment of BV viremia over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks up to 24 months after renal transplant

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the diagnosis of BK viremia in relations to the immunosuppressant drug, dose, and blood levels over time until resolution of BK viremia
secondary_outcome.measure: Association of BK viremia with immunosupressive therapy (drug, doses, blood concentrations)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks and up to 24 months after renal transplant

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the incidence of BK viremia  diagnosis relative to renal transplant study population donor/recipient HLA matching.
secondary_outcome.measure: Association of BK viremia with donor/recipient HLA matching
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks and up to 24 months after transplant

secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the incidence of BK viremia diagnosis  relative to renal transplant study population demographic features (gender, age, ethnicity/race).
secondary_outcome.measure: Association of BK viremis with recipient demographic features
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 weeks and up to 24 months after renal transplant

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
clinical_study.why_stopped: This study is being withdrawn from Clinicaltrials.gov because it is not an ACT.
